CreateImportJob.name: CreateImportJob
CreateImportJob.documentation: Creates or updates an import job.

CreateSegment.name: CreateSegment
CreateSegment.documentation: Used to create or update a segment.

DeleteApnsChannel.documentation: Deletes the APNs channel for an app.

DeleteApnsVoipSandboxChannel.name: DeleteApnsVoipSandboxChannel
DeleteApnsVoipSandboxChannel.documentation: Delete an APNS VoIP sandbox channel

DeleteEventStream.name: DeleteEventStream
DeleteEventStream.documentation: Deletes the event stream for an app.

DeleteGcmChannel.name: DeleteGcmChannel
DeleteGcmChannel.documentation: Deletes the GCM channel for an app.

GetApnsChannel.name: GetApnsChannel
GetApnsChannel.documentation: Returns information about the APNs channel for an app.

GetApplicationSettings.name: GetApplicationSettings
GetApplicationSettings.documentation: Used to request the settings for an app.

GetCampaignActivities.name: GetCampaignActivities
GetCampaignActivities.documentation: Returns information about the activity performed by a campaign.

GetCampaignVersion.name: GetCampaignVersion
GetCampaignVersion.documentation: Returns information about a specific version of a campaign.

GetCampaignVersions.name: GetCampaignVersions
GetCampaignVersions.documentation: Returns information about your campaign versions.

GetEventStream.name: GetEventStream
GetEventStream.documentation: Returns the event stream for an app.

GetExportJob.name: GetExportJob
GetExportJob.documentation: Returns information about an export job.

GetExportJobs.name: GetExportJobs
GetExportJobs.documentation: Returns information about your export jobs.

GetGcmChannel.name: GetGcmChannel
GetGcmChannel.documentation: Returns information about the GCM channel for an app.

GetImportJob.name: GetImportJob
GetImportJob.documentation: Returns information about an import job.

GetImportJobs.name: GetImportJobs
GetImportJobs.documentation: Returns information about your import jobs.

GetSegmentExportJobs.name: GetSegmentExportJobs
GetSegmentExportJobs.documentation: Returns a list of export jobs for a specific segment.

GetSegmentImportJobs.name: GetSegmentImportJobs
GetSegmentImportJobs.documentation: Returns a list of import jobs for a specific segment.

GetSegmentVersion.name: GetSegmentVersion
GetSegmentVersion.documentation: Returns information about a segment version.

GetSegmentVersions.name: GetSegmentVersions
GetSegmentVersions.documentation: Returns information about your segment versions.

GetSegments.name: GetSegments
GetSegments.documentation: Used to get information about your segments.

PutEventStream.name: PutEventStream
PutEventStream.documentation: Use to create or update the event stream for an app.

SendUsersMessages.name: SendUsersMessages
SendUsersMessages.documentation: Send a batch of messages to users

UpdateApnsChannel.name: UpdateApnsChannel
UpdateApnsChannel.documentation: Use to update the APNs channel for an app.

UpdateApnsVoipSandboxChannel.name: UpdateApnsVoipSandboxChannel
UpdateApnsVoipSandboxChannel.documentation: Update an APNS VoIP sandbox channel

UpdateApplicationSettings.name: UpdateApplicationSettings
UpdateApplicationSettings.documentation: Used to update the settings for an app.

UpdateEndpointsBatch.name: UpdateEndpointsBatch
UpdateEndpointsBatch.documentation: Use to update a batch of endpoints.

UpdateGcmChannel.name: UpdateGcmChannel
UpdateGcmChannel.documentation: Use to update the GCM channel for an app.

ClientId.documentation: Client ID as gotten from Amazon

ClientSecret.documentation: Client secret as gotten from Amazon

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the channel applies.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with ADM credentials. Amazon Pinpoint uses your credentials to authenticate push notifications with ADM. Provide your credentials by setting the ClientId and ClientSecret attributes.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

Action.documentation: The action that occurs if the user taps a push notification delivered by the campaign: OPEN_APP - Your app launches, or it becomes the foreground app if it has been sent to the background. This is the default action. DEEP_LINK - Uses deep linking features in iOS and Android to open your app and display a designated user interface within the app. URL - The default mobile browser on the user's device launches and opens a web page at the URL you specify. Possible values include: OPEN_APP | DEEP_LINK | URL

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

ConsolidationKey.documentation: Optional. Arbitrary string used to indicate multiple messages are logically the same and that ADM is allowed to drop previously enqueued messages in favor of this one.

Data.documentation: The data payload used for a silent push. This payload is added to the notifications' data.pinpoint.jsonBody' object

ExpiresAfter.documentation: Optional. Number of seconds ADM should retain the message if the device is offline

IconReference.documentation: The icon image name of the asset saved in your application.

ImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used as the large icon to the notification content view.

ImageUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used in the push notification.

MD5.documentation: Optional. Base-64-encoded MD5 checksum of the data parameter. Used to verify data integrity

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

SilentPush.documentation: Indicates if the message should display on the users device. Silent pushes can be used for Remote Configuration and Phone Home use cases.

SmallImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used as the small icon for the notification which will be used to represent the notification in the status bar and content view

Sound.documentation: Indicates a sound to play when the device receives the notification. Supports default, or the filename of a sound resource bundled in the app. Android sound files must reside in /res/raw/

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

Title.documentation: The message title that displays above the message on the user's device.

Url.documentation: The URL to open in the user's mobile browser. Used if the value for Action is URL.

BundleId.documentation: The bundle id used for APNs Tokens.

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

TeamId.documentation: The team id used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKey.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKeyId.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

APNSChannelRequest.documentation: Apple Push Notification Service channel definition.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the channel applies.

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with APNs credentials. Amazon Pinpoint uses your credentials to authenticate push notifications with APNs. To use APNs token authentication, set the BundleId, TeamId, TokenKey, and TokenKeyId attributes. To use certificate authentication, set the Certificate and PrivateKey attributes.

HasTokenKey.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with a key for APNs token authentication. Provide a token key by setting the TokenKey attribute.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used. Present only for backwards compatibility.

Platform.documentation: The platform type. Will be APNS.

APNSChannelResponse.documentation: Apple Distribution Push Notification Service channel definition.

Action.documentation: The action that occurs if the user taps a push notification delivered by the campaign: OPEN_APP - Your app launches, or it becomes the foreground app if it has been sent to the background. This is the default action. DEEP_LINK - Uses deep linking features in iOS and Android to open your app and display a designated user interface within the app. URL - The default mobile browser on the user's device launches and opens a web page at the URL you specify. Possible values include: OPEN_APP | DEEP_LINK | URL

Badge.documentation: Include this key when you want the system to modify the badge of your app icon. If this key is not included in the dictionary, the badge is not changed. To remove the badge, set the value of this key to 0.

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

Category.documentation: Provide this key with a string value that represents the notification's type. This value corresponds to the value in the identifier property of one of your app's registered categories.

CollapseId.documentation: An ID that, if assigned to multiple messages, causes APNs to coalesce the messages into a single push notification instead of delivering each message individually. The value must not exceed 64 bytes. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to set the apns-collapse-id request header when it sends the message to APNs.

Data.documentation: The data payload used for a silent push. This payload is added to the notifications' data.pinpoint.jsonBody' object

MediaUrl.documentation: The URL that points to a video used in the push notification.

PreferredAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The preferred authentication method, either "CERTIFICATE" or "TOKEN"

Priority.documentation:
The message priority. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to set the apns-priority request header when it sends the message to APNs. Accepts the following values:

"5" - Low priority. Messages might be delayed, delivered in groups, and throttled.

"10" - High priority. Messages are sent immediately. High priority messages must cause an alert, sound, or badge on the receiving device.

The default value is "10".

The equivalent values for FCM or GCM messages are "normal" and "high". Amazon Pinpoint accepts these values for APNs messages and converts them.

For more information about the apns-priority parameter, see Communicating with APNs in the APNs Local and Remote Notification Programming Guide.

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

SilentPush.documentation: Indicates if the message should display on the users device. Silent pushes can be used for Remote Configuration and Phone Home use cases.

Sound.documentation: Include this key when you want the system to play a sound. The value of this key is the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or in the Library/Sounds folder of your app's data container. If the sound file cannot be found, or if you specify defaultfor the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

ThreadId.documentation: Provide this key with a string value that represents the app-specific identifier for grouping notifications. If you provide a Notification Content app extension, you can use this value to group your notifications together.

TimeToLive.documentation: The length of time (in seconds) that APNs stores and attempts to deliver the message. If the value is 0, APNs does not store the message or attempt to deliver it more than once. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to set the apns-expiration request header when it sends the message to APNs.

Title.documentation: The message title that displays above the message on the user's device.

Url.documentation: The URL to open in the user's mobile browser. Used if the value for Action is URL.

BundleId.documentation: The bundle id used for APNs Tokens.

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

TeamId.documentation: The team id used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKey.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKeyId.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

APNSSandboxChannelRequest.documentation: Apple Development Push Notification Service channel definition.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the channel applies.

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with APNs credentials. Amazon Pinpoint uses your credentials to authenticate push notifications with APNs. To use APNs token authentication, set the BundleId, TeamId, TokenKey, and TokenKeyId attributes. To use certificate authentication, set the Certificate and PrivateKey attributes.

HasTokenKey.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with a key for APNs token authentication. Provide a token key by setting the TokenKey attribute.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

Platform.documentation: The platform type. Will be APNS_SANDBOX.

APNSSandboxChannelResponse.documentation: Apple Development Push Notification Service channel definition.

BundleId.documentation: The bundle id used for APNs Tokens.

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

TeamId.documentation: The team id used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKey.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKeyId.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

APNSVoipChannelRequest.documentation: Apple VoIP Push Notification Service channel definition.

ApplicationId.documentation: Application id

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: If the channel is registered with a credential for authentication.

HasTokenKey.documentation: If the channel is registered with a token key for authentication.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

Platform.documentation: The platform type. Will be APNS.

APNSVoipChannelResponse.documentation: Apple VoIP Push Notification Service channel definition.

BundleId.documentation: The bundle id used for APNs Tokens.

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

TeamId.documentation: The team id used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKey.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

TokenKeyId.documentation: The token key used for APNs Tokens.

APNSVoipSandboxChannelRequest.documentation: Apple VoIP Developer Push Notification Service channel definition.

ApplicationId.documentation: Application id

DefaultAuthenticationMethod.documentation: The default authentication method used for APNs.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: If the channel is registered with a credential for authentication.

HasTokenKey.documentation: If the channel is registered with a token key for authentication.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

Platform.documentation: The platform type. Will be APNS.

APNSVoipSandboxChannelResponse.documentation: Apple VoIP Developer Push Notification Service channel definition.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the campaign applies.

CampaignId.documentation: The ID of the campaign to which the activity applies.

End.documentation: The actual time the activity was marked CANCELLED or COMPLETED. Provided in ISO 8601 format.

Result.documentation:
Indicates whether the activity succeeded.

Valid values: SUCCESS, FAIL

ScheduledStart.documentation: The scheduled start time for the activity in ISO 8601 format.

Start.documentation: The actual start time of the activity in ISO 8601 format.

State.documentation:
The state of the activity.

Valid values: PENDING, INITIALIZING, RUNNING, PAUSED, CANCELLED, COMPLETED

SuccessfulEndpointCount.documentation: The total number of endpoints to which the campaign successfully delivered messages.

TimezonesCompletedCount.documentation: The total number of timezones completed.

TimezonesTotalCount.documentation: The total number of unique timezones present in the segment.

TotalEndpointCount.documentation: The total number of endpoints to which the campaign attempts to deliver messages.

TreatmentId.documentation: The ID of a variation of the campaign used for A/B testing.

BodyOverride.documentation: Body override. If specified will override default body.

ChannelType.documentation:
The channel type.

Valid values: GCM | APNS | APNS_SANDBOX | APNS_VOIP | APNS_VOIP_SANDBOX | ADM | SMS | EMAIL | BAIDU

Context.documentation: A map of custom attributes to attributes to be attached to the message for this address. This payload is added to the push notification's 'data.pinpoint' object or added to the email/sms delivery receipt event attributes.

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

Substitutions.documentation: A map of substitution values for the message to be merged with the DefaultMessage's substitutions. Substitutions on this map take precedence over the all other substitutions.

TitleOverride.documentation: Title override. If specified will override default title if applicable.

Name.documentation: The display name of the application.

ApplicationId.documentation: The unique ID for the application.

LastModifiedDate.documentation: The date that the settings were last updated in ISO 8601 format.

Limits.documentation: The default campaign limits for the app. These limits apply to each campaign for the app, unless the campaign overrides the default with limits of its own.

QuietTime.documentation: The default quiet time for the app. Each campaign for this app sends no messages during this time unless the campaign overrides the default with a quiet time of its own.

Item.documentation: List of applications returned in this page.

NextToken.documentation: The string that you use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

AttributeType.documentation:
The type of dimension:
INCLUSIVE - Endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment.
EXCLUSIVE - Endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

Values.documentation: The criteria values for the segment dimension. Endpoints with matching attribute values are included or excluded from the segment, depending on the setting for Type.

Message.documentation: The error message returned from the API.

ApiKey.documentation: Platform credential API key from Baidu.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

SecretKey.documentation: Platform credential Secret key from Baidu.

ApplicationId.documentation: Application id

Credential.documentation: The Baidu API key from Baidu.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with Baidu Cloud Push credentials. Amazon Pinpoint uses your credentials to authenticate push notifications with Baidu Cloud Push. Provide your credentials by setting the ApiKey and SecretKey attributes.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

Platform.documentation: The platform type. Will be BAIDU

Action.documentation: The action that occurs if the user taps a push notification delivered by the campaign: OPEN_APP - Your app launches, or it becomes the foreground app if it has been sent to the background. This is the default action. DEEP_LINK - Uses deep linking features in iOS and Android to open your app and display a designated user interface within the app. URL - The default mobile browser on the user's device launches and opens a web page at the URL you specify. Possible values include: OPEN_APP | DEEP_LINK | URL

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

Data.documentation: The data payload used for a silent push. This payload is added to the notifications' data.pinpoint.jsonBody' object

IconReference.documentation: The icon image name of the asset saved in your application.

ImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used as the large icon to the notification content view.

ImageUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used in the push notification.

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

SilentPush.documentation: Indicates if the message should display on the users device. Silent pushes can be used for Remote Configuration and Phone Home use cases.

SmallImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used as the small icon for the notification which will be used to represent the notification in the status bar and content view

Sound.documentation: Indicates a sound to play when the device receives the notification. Supports default, or the filename of a sound resource bundled in the app. Android sound files must reside in /res/raw/

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

Title.documentation: The message title that displays above the message on the user's device.

Url.documentation: The URL to open in the user's mobile browser. Used if the value for Action is URL.

FromAddress.documentation: The email address used to send the email from. Defaults to use FromAddress specified in the Email Channel.

LambdaFunctionName.documentation: Lambda function name or arn to be called for delivery

Mode.documentation: What mode Lambda should be invoked in.

WebUrl.documentation: Web URL to call for hook. If the URL has authentication specified it will be added as authentication to the request

Daily.documentation: The maximum number of messages that the campaign can send daily.

MaximumDuration.documentation: The length of time (in seconds) that the campaign can run before it ends and message deliveries stop. This duration begins at the scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60.

MessagesPerSecond.documentation: The number of messages that the campaign can send per second. The minimum value is 50, and the maximum is 20000.

Total.documentation: The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send.

CampaignLimits.documentation: Campaign Limits are used to limit the number of messages that can be sent to a user.

AdditionalTreatments.documentation: Treatments that are defined in addition to the default treatment.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the campaign applies.

CreationDate.documentation: The date the campaign was created in ISO 8601 format.

DefaultState.documentation: The status of the campaign's default treatment. Only present for A/B test campaigns.

HoldoutPercent.documentation: The allocated percentage of end users who will not receive messages from this campaign.

IsPaused.documentation: Indicates whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign does not send messages unless you resume it by setting IsPaused to false.

LastModifiedDate.documentation: The date the campaign was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

Name.documentation: The custom name of the campaign.

SegmentId.documentation: The ID of the segment to which the campaign sends messages.

SegmentVersion.documentation: The version of the segment to which the campaign sends messages.

State.documentation:
The campaign status.

An A/B test campaign will have a status of COMPLETED only when all treatments have a status of COMPLETED.

TreatmentDescription.documentation: A custom description for the treatment.

TreatmentName.documentation: The custom name of a variation of the campaign used for A/B testing.

MessageType.documentation: Is this is a transactional SMS message, otherwise a promotional message.

CampaignStatus.documentation:
The status of the campaign, or the status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.

Valid values: SCHEDULED, EXECUTING, PENDING_NEXT_RUN, COMPLETED, PAUSED

NextToken.documentation: The string that you use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

Name.documentation: The display name of the application. Used in the Amazon Pinpoint console.

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

DefaultMessage.documentation: Default Message across push notification, email, and sms.

Action.documentation: The action that occurs if the user taps a push notification delivered by the campaign: OPEN_APP - Your app launches, or it becomes the foreground app if it has been sent to the background. This is the default action. DEEP_LINK - Uses deep linking features in iOS and Android to open your app and display a designated user interface within the app. URL - The default mobile browser on the user's device launches and opens a web page at the URL you specify. Possible values include: OPEN_APP | DEEP_LINK | URL

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

Data.documentation: The data payload used for a silent push. This payload is added to the notifications' data.pinpoint.jsonBody' object

SilentPush.documentation: Indicates if the message should display on the users device. Silent pushes can be used for Remote Configuration and Phone Home use cases.

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

Title.documentation: The message title that displays above the message on the user's device.

Url.documentation: The URL to open in the user's mobile browser. Used if the value for Action is URL.

ApplicationId.documentation: ApplicationId

ADMMessage.documentation: The message to ADM channels. Overrides the default push notification message.

APNSMessage.documentation: The message to APNS channels. Overrides the default push notification message.

BaiduMessage.documentation: The message to Baidu GCM channels. Overrides the default push notification message.

DefaultMessage.documentation: The default message for all channels.

DefaultPushNotificationMessage.documentation: The default push notification message for all push channels.

GCMMessage.documentation: The message to GCM channels. Overrides the default push notification message.

SMSMessage.documentation: The message to SMS channels. Overrides the default message.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

FromAddress.documentation: The email address used to send emails from.

Identity.documentation: The ARN of an identity verified with SES.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of an IAM Role used to submit events to Mobile Analytics' event ingestion service

ApplicationId.documentation: The unique ID of the application to which the email channel belongs.

CreationDate.documentation: The date that the settings were last updated in ISO 8601 format.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

FromAddress.documentation: The email address used to send emails from.

HasCredential.documentation: If the channel is registered with a credential for authentication.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

Identity.documentation: The ARN of an identity verified with SES.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of an IAM Role used to submit events to Mobile Analytics' event ingestion service

Address.documentation: The address or token of the endpoint as provided by your push provider (e.g. DeviceToken or RegistrationId).

Attributes.documentation:
Custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. For example, an attribute named "interests" might have the values ["science", "politics", "travel"]. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create a segment of users to engage with a messaging campaign.

The following characters are not recommended in attribute names: # : ? \ /. The Amazon Pinpoint console does not display attributes that include these characters in the name. This limitation does not apply to attribute values.

ChannelType.documentation:
The channel type.

Valid values: GCM | APNS | APNS_SANDBOX | APNS_VOIP | APNS_VOIP_SANDBOX | ADM | SMS | EMAIL | BAIDU

EffectiveDate.documentation: The last time the endpoint was updated. Provided in ISO 8601 format.

EndpointStatus.documentation: The endpoint status. Can be either ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Will be set to INACTIVE if a delivery fails. Will be set to ACTIVE if the address is updated.

Id.documentation: The unique Id for the Endpoint in the batch.

Metrics.documentation: Custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint.

OptOut.documentation:
Indicates whether a user has opted out of receiving messages with one of the following values:

ALL - User has opted out of all messages.

NONE - Users has not opted out and receives all messages.

RequestId.documentation: The unique ID for the most recent request to update the endpoint.

User.documentation: Custom user-specific attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint.

Item.documentation: List of items to update. Maximum 100 items

AppVersion.documentation: The version of the application associated with the endpoint.

Locale.documentation: The endpoint locale in the following format: The ISO 639-1 alpha-2 code, followed by an underscore, followed by an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 value.

Make.documentation: The endpoint make, such as such as Apple or Samsung.

Model.documentation: The endpoint model, such as iPhone.

Platform.documentation: The endpoint platform, such as ios or android.

Timezone.documentation: The timezone of the endpoint. Specified as a tz database value, such as Americas/Los_Angeles.

City.documentation: The city where the endpoint is located.

Country.documentation: Country according to ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 codes. For example, US.

Latitude.documentation: The latitude of the endpoint location. Rounded to one decimal (Roughly corresponding to a mile).

Longitude.documentation: The longitude of the endpoint location. Rounded to one decimal (Roughly corresponding to a mile).

PostalCode.documentation: The postal code or zip code of the endpoint.

Region.documentation: The region of the endpoint location. For example, corresponds to a state in US.

Address.documentation: Address that endpoint message was delivered to.

UpdatedToken.documentation: If token was updated as part of delivery. (This is GCM Specific)

EndpointMessageResult.documentation: The result from sending a message to an endpoint.

Address.documentation: The address or token of the endpoint as provided by your push provider (e.g. DeviceToken or RegistrationId).

Attributes.documentation:
Custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. For example, an attribute named "interests" might have the values ["science", "politics", "travel"]. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create a segment of users to engage with a messaging campaign.

The following characters are not recommended in attribute names: # : ? \ /. The Amazon Pinpoint console does not display attributes that include these characters in the name. This limitation does not apply to attribute values.

ChannelType.documentation:
The channel type.

Valid values: GCM | APNS | APNS_SANDBOX | APNS_VOIP | APNS_VOIP_SANDBOX | ADM | SMS | EMAIL | BAIDU

EffectiveDate.documentation: The last time the endpoint was updated. Provided in ISO 8601 format.

EndpointStatus.documentation: The endpoint status. Can be either ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Will be set to INACTIVE if a delivery fails. Will be set to ACTIVE if the address is updated.

Metrics.documentation: Custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint.

OptOut.documentation:
Indicates whether a user has opted out of receiving messages with one of the following values:

ALL - User has opted out of all messages.

NONE - Users has not opted out and receives all messages.

RequestId.documentation: The unique ID for the most recent request to update the endpoint.

User.documentation: Custom user-specific attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint.

Address.documentation: The address or token of the endpoint as provided by your push provider (e.g. DeviceToken or RegistrationId).

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application associated with the endpoint.

Attributes.documentation:
Custom attributes that describe the endpoint by associating a name with an array of values. For example, an attribute named "interests" might have the values ["science", "politics", "travel"]. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create a segment of users to engage with a messaging campaign.

The following characters are not recommended in attribute names: # : ? \ /. The Amazon Pinpoint console does not display attributes that include these characters in the name. This limitation does not apply to attribute values.

ChannelType.documentation:
The channel type.

Valid values: GCM | APNS | APNS_SANDBOX | APNS_VOIP | APNS_VOIP_SANDBOX | ADM | SMS | EMAIL | BAIDU

CohortId.documentation: A number from 0 - 99 that represents the cohort the endpoint is assigned to. Endpoints are grouped into cohorts randomly, and each cohort contains approximately 1 percent of the endpoints for an app. Amazon Pinpoint assigns cohorts to the holdout or treatment allocations for a campaign.

CreationDate.documentation: The last time the endpoint was created. Provided in ISO 8601 format.

EffectiveDate.documentation: The last time the endpoint was updated. Provided in ISO 8601 format.

EndpointStatus.documentation: The endpoint status. Can be either ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Will be set to INACTIVE if a delivery fails. Will be set to ACTIVE if the address is updated.

Id.documentation: The unique ID that you assigned to the endpoint. The ID should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) to ensure that it is unique compared to all other endpoints for the application.

Metrics.documentation: Custom metrics that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint.

OptOut.documentation:
Indicates whether a user has opted out of receiving messages with one of the following values:

ALL - User has opted out of all messages.

NONE - Users has not opted out and receives all messages.

RequestId.documentation: The unique ID for the most recent request to update the endpoint.

User.documentation: Custom user-specific attributes that your app reports to Amazon Pinpoint.

BodyOverride.documentation: Body override. If specified will override default body.

Context.documentation: A map of custom attributes to attributes to be attached to the message for this address. This payload is added to the push notification's 'data.pinpoint' object or added to the email/sms delivery receipt event attributes.

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

Substitutions.documentation: A map of substitution values for the message to be merged with the DefaultMessage's substitutions. Substitutions on this map take precedence over the all other substitutions.

TitleOverride.documentation: Title override. If specified will override default title if applicable.

UserAttributes.documentation:
Custom attributes that describe an end user by associating a name with an array of values. For example, an attribute named "interests" might have the values ["science", "politics", "travel"]. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create a segment of users to engage with a messaging campaign.

The following characters are not recommended in attribute names: # : ? \ /. The Amazon Pinpoint console does not display attributes that include these characters in the name. This limitation does not apply to attribute values.

UserId.documentation: The unique ID of the user.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application from which events should be published.

DestinationStreamArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis stream or Firehose delivery stream to which you want to publish events.
 Firehose ARN: arn:aws:firehose:REGION:ACCOUNT_ID:deliverystream/STREAM_NAME
 Kinesis ARN: arn:aws:kinesis:REGION:ACCOUNT_ID:stream/STREAM_NAME

ExternalId.documentation: DEPRECATED. Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to the ExternalID key in an IAM trust policy. Used by Amazon Pinpoint to assume an IAM role. This requirement is removed, and external IDs are not recommended for IAM roles assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

LastModifiedDate.documentation: The date the event stream was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

LastUpdatedBy.documentation: The IAM user who last modified the event stream.

RoleArn.documentation: The IAM role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to publish events to the stream in your account.

EventStream.documentation: Model for an event publishing subscription export.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that grants Amazon Pinpoint access to the Amazon S3 location that endpoints will be exported to.

S3UrlPrefix.documentation:
A URL that points to the location within an Amazon S3 bucket that will receive the export. The location is typically a folder with multiple files.
The URL should follow this format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/

Amazon Pinpoint will export endpoints to this location.

SegmentId.documentation: The ID of the segment to export endpoints from. If not present all endpoints will be exported.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that grants Amazon Pinpoint access to the Amazon S3 location that endpoints will be exported to.

S3UrlPrefix.documentation:
A URL that points to the location within an Amazon S3 bucket that will receive the export. The location is typically a folder with multiple files.
The URL should follow this format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/

Amazon Pinpoint will export endpoints to this location.

SegmentId.documentation: The ID of the segment to export endpoints from. If not present, all endpoints are exported.

ApplicationId.documentation: The unique ID of the application to which the job applies.

CompletedPieces.documentation: The number of pieces that have successfully completed as of the time of the request.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date the job completed in ISO 8601 format.

CreationDate.documentation: The date the job was created in ISO 8601 format.

FailedPieces.documentation: The number of pieces that failed to be processed as of the time of the request.

Failures.documentation: Provides up to 100 of the first failed entries for the job, if any exist.

Id.documentation: The unique ID of the job.

JobStatus.documentation:
The status of the job.
Valid values: CREATED, INITIALIZING, PROCESSING, COMPLETING, COMPLETED, FAILING, FAILED

The job status is FAILED if one or more pieces failed.

TotalFailures.documentation: The number of endpoints that were not processed; for example, because of syntax errors.

TotalPieces.documentation: The total number of pieces that must be processed to finish the job. Each piece is an approximately equal portion of the endpoints.

TotalProcessed.documentation: The number of endpoints that were processed by the job.

Item.documentation: A list of export jobs for the application.

NextToken.documentation: The string that you use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

Message.documentation: The error message returned from the API.

ApiKey.documentation: Platform credential API key from Google.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the channel applies.

Credential.documentation: The GCM API key from Google.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: Indicates whether the channel is configured with FCM or GCM credentials. Amazon Pinpoint uses your credentials to authenticate push notifications with FCM or GCM. Provide your credentials by setting the ApiKey attribute.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used. Present only for backwards compatibility.

Platform.documentation: The platform type. Will be GCM

Action.documentation: The action that occurs if the user taps a push notification delivered by the campaign: OPEN_APP - Your app launches, or it becomes the foreground app if it has been sent to the background. This is the default action. DEEP_LINK - Uses deep linking features in iOS and Android to open your app and display a designated user interface within the app. URL - The default mobile browser on the user's device launches and opens a web page at the URL you specify. Possible values include: OPEN_APP | DEEP_LINK | URL

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

CollapseKey.documentation: This parameter identifies a group of messages (e.g., with collapse_key: "Updates Available") that can be collapsed, so that only the last message gets sent when delivery can be resumed. This is intended to avoid sending too many of the same messages when the device comes back online or becomes active.

Data.documentation: The data payload used for a silent push. This payload is added to the notifications' data.pinpoint.jsonBody' object

IconReference.documentation: The icon image name of the asset saved in your application.

ImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used as the large icon to the notification content view.

ImageUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used in the push notification.

Priority.documentation:
The message priority. Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to set the FCM or GCM priority parameter when it sends the message. Accepts the following values:

"Normal" - Messages might be delayed. Delivery is optimized for battery usage on the receiving device. Use normal priority unless immediate delivery is required.

"High" - Messages are sent immediately and might wake a sleeping device.

The equivalent values for APNs messages are "5" and "10". Amazon Pinpoint accepts these values here and converts them.

For more information, see About FCM Messages in the Firebase documentation.

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

RestrictedPackageName.documentation: This parameter specifies the package name of the application where the registration tokens must match in order to receive the message.

SilentPush.documentation: Indicates if the message should display on the users device. Silent pushes can be used for Remote Configuration and Phone Home use cases.

SmallImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used as the small icon for the notification which will be used to represent the notification in the status bar and content view

Sound.documentation: Indicates a sound to play when the device receives the notification. Supports default, or the filename of a sound resource bundled in the app. Android sound files must reside in /res/raw/

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

TimeToLive.documentation: The length of time (in seconds) that FCM or GCM stores and attempts to deliver the message. If unspecified, the value defaults to the maximum, which is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days). Amazon Pinpoint uses this value to set the FCM or GCM time_to_live parameter.

Title.documentation: The message title that displays above the message on the user's device.

Url.documentation: The URL to open in the user's mobile browser. Used if the value for Action is URL.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

ApplicationId.documentation: ApplicationId

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

PageSize.documentation: The number of entries you want on each page in the response.

Token.documentation: The NextToken string returned on a previous page that you use to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

DefineSegment.documentation: Sets whether the endpoints create a segment when they are imported.

ExternalId.documentation: DEPRECATED. Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to the ExternalID key in an IAM trust policy. Used by Amazon Pinpoint to assume an IAM role. This requirement is removed, and external IDs are not recommended for IAM roles assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

Format.documentation:
The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions.
Valid values: CSV, JSON

RegisterEndpoints.documentation: Sets whether the endpoints are registered with Amazon Pinpoint when they are imported.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that grants Amazon Pinpoint access to the Amazon S3 location that contains the endpoints to import.

S3Url.documentation:
A URL that points to the location within an Amazon S3 bucket that contains the endpoints to import. The location can be a folder or a single file.
The URL should follow this format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name

Amazon Pinpoint will import endpoints from this location and any subfolders it contains.

SegmentId.documentation: The ID of the segment to update if the import job is meant to update an existing segment.

SegmentName.documentation: A custom name for the segment created by the import job. Use if DefineSegment is true.

DefineSegment.documentation: Sets whether the endpoints create a segment when they are imported.

ExternalId.documentation: DEPRECATED. Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to the ExternalID key in an IAM trust policy. Used by Amazon Pinpoint to assume an IAM role. This requirement is removed, and external IDs are not recommended for IAM roles assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

Format.documentation:
The format of the files that contain the endpoint definitions.
Valid values: CSV, JSON

RegisterEndpoints.documentation: Sets whether the endpoints are registered with Amazon Pinpoint when they are imported.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that grants Amazon Pinpoint access to the Amazon S3 location that contains the endpoints to import.

S3Url.documentation:
A URL that points to the location within an Amazon S3 bucket that contains the endpoints to import. The location can be a folder or a single file.
The URL should follow this format: s3://bucket-name/folder-name/file-name

Amazon Pinpoint will import endpoints from this location and any subfolders it contains.

SegmentId.documentation: The ID of the segment to update if the import job is meant to update an existing segment.

SegmentName.documentation: A custom name for the segment created by the import job. Use if DefineSegment is true.

ApplicationId.documentation: The unique ID of the application to which the import job applies.

CompletedPieces.documentation: The number of pieces that have successfully imported as of the time of the request.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date the import job completed in ISO 8601 format.

CreationDate.documentation: The date the import job was created in ISO 8601 format.

FailedPieces.documentation: The number of pieces that have failed to import as of the time of the request.

Failures.documentation: Provides up to 100 of the first failed entries for the job, if any exist.

Id.documentation: The unique ID of the import job.

JobStatus.documentation:
The status of the import job.
Valid values: CREATED, INITIALIZING, PROCESSING, COMPLETING, COMPLETED, FAILING, FAILED

The job status is FAILED if one or more pieces failed to import.

TotalFailures.documentation: The number of endpoints that failed to import; for example, because of syntax errors.

TotalPieces.documentation: The total number of pieces that must be imported to finish the job. Each piece is an approximately equal portion of the endpoints to import.

TotalProcessed.documentation: The number of endpoints that were processed by the import job.

Type.documentation: The job type. Will be Import.

Item.documentation: A list of import jobs for the application.

NextToken.documentation: The string that you use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response.

Message.documentation: The error message returned from the API.

Action.documentation:
The action that occurs if the user taps a push notification delivered by the campaign:
OPEN_APP - Your app launches, or it becomes the foreground app if it has been sent to the background. This is the default action.

DEEP_LINK - Uses deep linking features in iOS and Android to open your app and display a designated user interface within the app.

URL - The default mobile browser on the user's device launches and opens a web page at the URL you specify.

Body.documentation: The message body. Can include up to 140 characters.

ImageIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to the icon image for the push notification icon, for example, the app icon.

ImageSmallIconUrl.documentation: The URL that points to the small icon image for the push notification icon, for example, the app icon.

ImageUrl.documentation: The URL that points to an image used in the push notification.

JsonBody.documentation: The JSON payload used for a silent push.

MediaUrl.documentation: The URL that points to the media resource, for example a .mp4 or .gif file.

RawContent.documentation: The Raw JSON formatted string to be used as the payload. This value overrides the message.

SilentPush.documentation:
Indicates if the message should display on the users device.

Silent pushes can be used for Remote Configuration and Phone Home use cases.

Title.documentation: The message title that displays above the message on the user's device.

Url.documentation: The URL to open in the user's mobile browser. Used if the value for Action is URL.

Message.documentation: The error message returned from the API.

ADMMessage.documentation: The message that the campaign delivers to ADM channels. Overrides the default message.

APNSMessage.documentation: The message that the campaign delivers to APNS channels. Overrides the default message.

BaiduMessage.documentation: The message that the campaign delivers to Baidu channels. Overrides the default message.

DefaultMessage.documentation: The default message for all channels.

GCMMessage.documentation: The message that the campaign delivers to GCM channels. Overrides the default message.

Addresses.documentation: A map of destination addresses, with the address as the key(Email address, phone number or push token) and the Address Configuration as the value.

Context.documentation: A map of custom attributes to attributes to be attached to the message. This payload is added to the push notification's 'data.pinpoint' object or added to the email/sms delivery receipt event attributes.

Endpoints.documentation: A map of destination addresses, with the address as the key(Email address, phone number or push token) and the Address Configuration as the value.

ApplicationId.documentation: Application id of the message.

EndpointResult.documentation: A map containing a multi part response for each address, with the endpointId as the key and the result as the value.

RequestId.documentation: Original request Id for which this message was delivered.

Result.documentation: A map containing a multi part response for each address, with the address as the key(Email address, phone number or push token) and the result as the value.

UpdatedToken.documentation: If token was updated as part of delivery. (This is GCM Specific)

MessageResult.documentation: The result from sending a message to an address.

Message.documentation: The error message returned from the API.
The error message returned from the API.

ApplicationId.documentation: ApplicationId

End.documentation: The default end time for quiet time in ISO 8601 format.

Start.documentation: The default start time for quiet time in ISO 8601 format.

Duration.documentation:
The length of time during which users have been active or inactive with your app.
Valid values: HR_24, DAY_7, DAY_14, DAY_30

RecencyType.documentation:
The recency dimension type:
ACTIVE - Users who have used your app within the specified duration are included in the segment.
INACTIVE - Users who have not used your app within the specified duration are included in the segment.

RecencyDimension.documentation: Define how a segment based on recency of use.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

ApplicationId.documentation: The unique ID of the application to which the SMS channel belongs.

CreationDate.documentation: The date that the settings were last updated in ISO 8601 format.

Enabled.documentation: If the channel is enabled for sending messages.

HasCredential.documentation: If the channel is registered with a credential for authentication.

Id.documentation: Channel ID. Not used, only for backwards compatibility.

ShortCode.documentation: The short code registered with the phone provider.

Body.documentation: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

MessageType.documentation: Is this a transaction priority message or lower priority.

Substitutions.documentation: Default message substitutions. Can be overridden by individual address substitutions.

EndTime.documentation: The scheduled time that the campaign ends in ISO 8601 format.

Frequency.documentation:
How often the campaign delivers messages.

Valid values: ONCE, HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY

IsLocalTime.documentation: Indicates whether the campaign schedule takes effect according to each user's local time.

QuietTime.documentation: The time during which the campaign sends no messages.

StartTime.documentation: The scheduled time that the campaign begins in ISO 8601 format.

Timezone.documentation:
The starting UTC offset for the schedule if the value for isLocalTime is true

Valid values: 
UTC
UTC+01
UTC+02
UTC+03
UTC+03:30
UTC+04
UTC+04:30
UTC+05
UTC+05:30
UTC+05:45
UTC+06
UTC+06:30
UTC+07
UTC+08
UTC+09
UTC+09:30
UTC+10
UTC+10:30
UTC+11
UTC+12
UTC+13
UTC-02
UTC-03
UTC-04
UTC-05
UTC-06
UTC-07
UTC-08
UTC-09
UTC-10
UTC-11

Schedule.documentation: Shcedule that defines when a campaign is run.

AppVersion.documentation: The app version criteria for the segment.

Channel.documentation: The channel criteria for the segment.

DeviceType.documentation: The device type criteria for the segment.

Make.documentation: The device make criteria for the segment.

Model.documentation: The device model criteria for the segment.

Platform.documentation: The device platform criteria for the segment.

ExternalId.documentation: DEPRECATED. Your AWS account ID, which you assigned to the ExternalID key in an IAM trust policy. Used by Amazon Pinpoint to assume an IAM role. This requirement is removed, and external IDs are not recommended for IAM roles assumed by Amazon Pinpoint.

Format.documentation:
The format of the endpoint files that were imported to create this segment.
Valid values: CSV, JSON

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that grants Amazon Pinpoint access to the endpoints in Amazon S3.

S3Url.documentation: A URL that points to the Amazon S3 location from which the endpoints for this segment were imported.

Size.documentation: The number of endpoints that were successfully imported to create this segment.

Country.documentation: The country filter according to ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 codes.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application to which the segment applies.

CreationDate.documentation: The date the segment was created in ISO 8601 format.

LastModifiedDate.documentation: The date the segment was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

SegmentType.documentation:
The segment type:
DIMENSIONAL - A dynamic segment built from selection criteria based on endpoint data reported by your app. You create this type of segment by using the segment builder in the Amazon Pinpoint console or by making a POST request to the segments resource.
IMPORT - A static segment built from an imported set of endpoint definitions. You create this type of segment by importing a segment in the Amazon Pinpoint console or by making a POST request to the jobs/import resource.

NextToken.documentation: An identifier used to retrieve the next page of results. The token is null if no additional pages exist.

Context.documentation: A map of custom attributes to attributes to be attached to the message. This payload is added to the push notification's 'data.pinpoint' object or added to the email/sms delivery receipt event attributes.

Users.documentation: A map of destination endpoints, with the EndpointId as the key Endpoint Message Configuration as the value.

ApplicationId.documentation: Application id of the message.

RequestId.documentation: Original request Id for which this message was delivered.

Result.documentation: A map containing of UserId to Map of EndpointId to Endpoint Message Result.

DimensionType.documentation:
The type of dimension:
INCLUSIVE - Endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment.
EXCLUSIVE - Endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

Values.documentation: The criteria values for the segment dimension. Endpoints with matching attribute values are included or excluded from the segment, depending on the setting for Type.

Message.documentation: The error message returned from the API.

SizePercent.documentation: The allocated percentage of users for this treatment.

TreatmentDescription.documentation: A custom description for the treatment.

TreatmentName.documentation: The custom name of a variation of the campaign used for A/B testing.

Limits.documentation: The default campaign limits for the app. These limits apply to each campaign for the app, unless the campaign overrides the default with limits of its own.

QuietTime.documentation: The default quiet time for the app. Each campaign for this app sends no messages during this time unless the campaign overrides the default with a quiet time of its own.

AdditionalTreatments.documentation: Treatments that are defined in addition to the default treatment.

HoldoutPercent.documentation: The allocated percentage of end users who will not receive messages from this campaign.

IsPaused.documentation: Indicates whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign does not send messages unless you resume it by setting IsPaused to false.

Name.documentation: The custom name of the campaign.

SegmentId.documentation: The ID of the segment to which the campaign sends messages.

SegmentVersion.documentation: The version of the segment to which the campaign sends messages.

TreatmentDescription.documentation: A custom description for the treatment.

TreatmentName.documentation: The custom name of a variation of the campaign used for A/B testing.

DestinationStreamArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis stream or Firehose delivery stream to which you want to publish events.
 Firehose ARN: arn:aws:firehose:REGION:ACCOUNT_ID:deliverystream/STREAM_NAME
 Kinesis ARN: arn:aws:kinesis:REGION:ACCOUNT_ID:stream/STREAM_NAME

RoleArn.documentation: The IAM role that authorizes Amazon Pinpoint to publish events to the stream in your account.

SizePercent.documentation: The allocated percentage of users for this treatment.

TreatmentDescription.documentation: A custom description for the treatment.

TreatmentName.documentation: The custom name of a variation of the campaign used for A/B testing.

WriteTreatmentResource.documentation: Used to create a campaign treatment.
